item.title: BI Consultant, Enterprise Data Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Enterprise Data & Advanced Analytics is responsible for establishing data as a strategic asset for CIBC, building out our data and analytics capabilities, and developing an enterprise-wide data enablement strategy. This role is key to deliver and provide expertise on BI & Analytics, data integration as well as UI design techniques. The ideal candidate is a self-motivated individual with knowledge of the technologies that are utilized to support CIBC\'s BI/Analytical standard tools.

How You\'ll Succeed

  • The BI Consultant will design and carry out the development of BI Analytics and data integration leveraging a wide variety of tools connected to multiple data sources, taking into account CIBC processes, methodologies, data flows, system dependencies.
  • You will Provide leadership in designing BI/Analytics development, implementation activities, future roadmap development of the Analytical environments & Analytical tools (Tableau, Alteryx, ThoughtSpot, SQL  etc.)
  • Identify opportunities to automate, streamline processes that will bring in efficiency in reporting and analytical environments, lessen manual intervention and increase end user efficiency.
  • Lead and partner with Business Analytics, Technology, Enterprise Architecture, and other business groups with a focus of fostering BI/Analytics research & innovation culture

What We’re Looking For

  • Practical knowledge and hands on experience in the area of Data Engineering, BI and Data Analytic, Big Data (Hadoop).
  • 3+ years of hands-on experience with Tableau, Alteryx, T-SQL (MS SQL), Python, Hive, Impala. Having exposure to Spark, HTML and Salesforce is an asset.
  • Presentation/interactive/analytical skills sufficient to convey both factual and conceptual information utilizing methodologies as  Rapid BI, Design Thinking and Storytelling.
  • Business analysis and consulting skills to precisely articulate & understand business requirements and ideas that involve interpretation, analysis, assessment and implementation. 
  • Working knowledge of CIBC’s organizational structure, facilities, policies, processes, products and operating procedures, guidelines and systems is preferable. 
  • Passionate innovators, creators, collaborators, and leaders who are up for the challenge of building the bank of the future and delivering solutions that meet our clients’ changing needs

Who You Are

  • You\'re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-55 Yonge Street, 6th

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

item.title: Sr. Data Scientist
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

The Data & Analytics team is a hub of data science expertise within CIBC, and is leading the way in applying the best practices in predictive science, machine learning, leveraging massive datasets and the latest in big data technology platforms. As a Senior Data Scientist in Advanced Analytics, you will work with business and technology partners to deliver solutions that meet their analytical needs and help serve our clients.

You will work with real world structured and unstructured datasets to produce end-to-end solutions, taking models from experiment to deployment. We collaborate with industry partners in the space of AI and machine learning, and engage with leading academic researchers to promote the exchange of ideas and enrich our talent.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Data Science Expertise: You will utilize your knowledge in statistics, machine learning and/or optimization to frame business problems in a data science context. You will build data products by writing code that is modular, reliable, maintainable & replicable.  
  • Consulting Mindset: You will communicate complex concepts in simple and elegant ways. You will work closely with our business partners to understand their challenges by asking the right questions to gather information. You will put in the effort to understand the business problem and to answer any questions and concerns brought up by our partners. 
  • Team Player: You will collaborate with data experts to learn about the data and engineer relevant features. You will effectively collaborate with other data scientists and engineers to learn about the data, engineer features and work together to build data products. 

Who You Are

  • You have an advanced degree in a scientific or quantitative field
  • You have minimum of 3 year experience in industry or research
  • You enjoy the challenge of leading engagements and coaching junior team members
  • You embrace change and advance our capability through continuous learning, sharing of knowledge with colleagues and partners, and encouraging constant improvement in how we do our work.
  • You have strong communication skills and an ability to present complex concepts clearly.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.
  • You have extensive knowledge of:
    • Programming in Python
    • Data science libraries (Pandas, scikit-learn, XGBoost, Dask, Matplotlib, Seaborn)
    • Writing queries in SQL and working with data warehouses
    • ML/AI Frameworks (Tensorflow, Pytorch)
    • Knowledge of NLP and associated toolkits (nltk, spaCy)
    • Software development and testing
  • Also beneficial:
    • Knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau
    • Understanding of Docker and Kubernetes
    • Exposure to big data frameworks (PySpark, SparkML)
    • Exposure Microsoft Azure cloud platform

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-CC North 26th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

item.title: Sr. Manager, Fraud Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

As the Senior Manager, Fraud Analytics, Risk Management you will be leading and supervising the work of a group of analysts with a focus on fraud mitigation, computer programming, statistical models, and reporting associated with the development and implementation of strategies. You will assist the team in the development and application of complex analysis, cost/benefits analysis, optimization, predictive models and sampling. You will maintain tight control over impact to legitimate customers from fraud management strategies and handle regular reporting of statistics to SVP and EVP levels of results in this area. You are curious, proactive, and constantly offer new solutions based on sound analysis.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Analytical Thinking – Improve fraud monitoring by responding to fraud trends and mitigate risk surrounding operational processes. Conduct feasibility studies and cost/benefit analysis to clearly depict possible fraud mitigation rule options and recommended courses of action.
  • Communication Skills –  Excellent verbal and writing skills to effectively articulate ideas and opinions that involve analysis, interpretation, and assessment.
  • Leadership Skills - Provide leadership and effective management of business unit staff to influence employee commitment to the organization

Who You Are

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You have experience in analytical techniques and constantly seek to improve your knowledge in this field. You have strong ability using  SAS, Tableau and/or SQL .
  • You have a degree/diploma in preferably Mathematics, Statistics, Business or Computer Science Based discipline.
  • You love to learn. You\'re passionate about growing your knowledge, and you know that there is no limit to what you can achieve.
  • You look beyond the moment. You make decisions and take actions that will make a difference today and tomorrow. You proactively seek new opportunities to define what\'s possible.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-750 Law Ave. W., E4

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5
